title: MESSENGER interplanetary magnetic field (1-second/high resolution) in RTN coordinates - Prof. Sean C. Solomon (Carnegie Institution of Washington)

info.x_cadence_note: Counts based on variable 'Epoch' in https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/sp_phys/data/messenger/mag/rtn_cdf/2004/messenger_mag_rtn_20040812_v01.cdf. The most common cadence, 50 [ms] = PT0.05S, occurred for 99.8280% of the 431717 timesteps.
info.contact: Prof. Sean C. Solomon @ Carnegie Institution of Washington

parameters.name: Time
parameters.x_description: Number of milliseconds since the epoch

parameters.name: radialDistance
parameters.description: Radial distance of MESSENGER from the Sun

parameters.name: latitude_ecliptic
parameters.description: ----> North latitude from the ecliptic plane

parameters.name: azimuth_ecliptic
parameters.description: ----> Azimuthal angle from Earth-Sun line in ecliptic plane, positive in the direction of Earth's motion

parameters.name: B_radial_q
parameters.description: (Good values only) B radial (Br) in RTN coordinates. This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function apply_rtn_qflag (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['B_radial', 'Quality_Flag']. Note that some COMPONENTS may not be available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.

parameters.name: B_tangential_q
parameters.description: ----> (Good values only) B tangential (Bt). This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function apply_rtn_qflag (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['B_tangential', 'Quality_Flag']. Note that some COMPONENTS may not be available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.

parameters.name: B_normal_q
parameters.description: ----> (Good values only) B normal (Bn). This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function apply_rtn_qflag (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['B_normal', 'Quality_Flag']. Note that some COMPONENTS may not be available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.

parameters.name: B_radial
parameters.description: (All qualities) B radial (Br) in RTN coordinates

parameters.name: Quality_Flag
parameters.description: 3-digit daily quality flag (222 or 223 = good = boom deployed, sensor in shadow, any heater contamination corrected)

parameters.name: Epoch_cadence
parameters.description: Data Cadence. This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function compute_cadence (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['Epoch']. Note that some COMPONENTS may not be available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.

title: MESSENGER interplanetary magnetic field (1-second/high resolution) in RTN coordinates - Prof. Sean C. Solomon (Carnegie Institution of Washington)

info.contact: Prof. Sean C. Solomon @ Carnegie Institution of Washington

parameters.name: Time
parameters.x_description: Number of milliseconds since the epoch

parameters.name: radialDistance_200
parameters.description: Radial distance of MESSENGER from the Sun (0.5 sec cadence). This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function apply_rtn_cadence (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['radialDistance', 'Epoch_cadence']. Note that some COMPONENTS may not be available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.

parameters.name: latitude_ecliptic_200
parameters.description: ----> North latitude from the ecliptic plane (0.5 sec cadence). This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function apply_rtn_cadence (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['latitude_ecliptic', 'Epoch_cadence']. Note that some COMPONENTS may not be available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.

parameters.name: azimuth_ecliptic_200
parameters.description: ----> Azimuthal angle from Earth-Sun line in ecliptic plane, positive in the direction of Earth's motion (0.5 sec cadence). This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function apply_rtn_cadence (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['azimuth_ecliptic', 'Epoch_cadence']. Note that some COMPONENTS may not be available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.

parameters.name: B_radial_200
parameters.description: (Good values at 0.5 sec cadence only) B radial (Br) in RTN coordinates. This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function apply_rtn_cadence (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['B_radial_q', 'Epoch_cadence']. Note that some COMPONENTS may not be available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.

parameters.name: B_tangential_200
parameters.description: ----> (Good values at 0.5 sec cadence only) B tangential (Bt). This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function apply_rtn_cadence (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['B_tangential_q', 'Epoch_cadence']. Note that some COMPONENTS may not be available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.

parameters.name: B_normal_200
parameters.description: ----> (Good values at 0.5 sec cadence only) B normal (Bn). This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function apply_rtn_cadence (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['B_normal_q', 'Epoch_cadence']. Note that some COMPONENTS may not be available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.
